attribute.targetType: TARGET_TYPE_PROC_CHIP, TARGET_TYPE_CORE, TARGET_TYPE_EX, TARGET_TYPE_EQ, TARGET_TYPE_MCS, TARGET_TYPE_MCA, TARGET_TYPE_MCBIST, TARGET_TYPE_MI, TARGET_TYPE_DMI, TARGET_TYPE_XBUS, TARGET_TYPE_OBUS, TARGET_TYPE_NV, TARGET_TYPE_SBE, TARGET_TYPE_PPE, TARGET_TYPE_PERV, TARGET_TYPE_PEC, TARGET_TYPE_PHB, TARGET_TYPE_CAPP, TARGET_TYPE_MEMBUF_CHIP, TARGET_TYPE_MBA, TARGET_TYPE_DIMM
attribute.description: 1 if the target is functional, else 0. Set by the platform.
Physical position of chip/dimm within drawer This data is from the MRW.

attribute.targetType: TARGET_TYPE_PROC_CHIP, TARGET_TYPE_MEMBUF_CHIP, TARGET_TYPE_DIMM, TARGET_TYPE_CORE, TARGET_TYPE_EX, TARGET_TYPE_EQ, TARGET_TYPE_MCS, TARGET_TYPE_MCA, TARGET_TYPE_MCBIST, TARGET_TYPE_MI, TARGET_TYPE_DMI, TARGET_TYPE_XBUS, TARGET_TYPE_OBUS, TARGET_TYPE_NV, TARGET_TYPE_SBE, TARGET_TYPE_PPE, TARGET_TYPE_PERV, TARGET_TYPE_PEC, TARGET_TYPE_PHB, TARGET_TYPE_CAPP, TARGET_TYPE_MBA
attribute.description: Logical position of target within a system. This is derived from the SMP location of each processor and each target's relationship to a proc. - PROC = based on SMP groupid+chipid - MEMBUF = PROC:FAPI_POS * [max membuf per proc] - 1st level child unit = [parent chip]:FAPI_POS * [max children of this type per chip] - 2nd+ level child unit = [immediate parent unit]:FAPI_POS * [max units below parent] Note: This should not be used algorithmically by HWPs directly. Note: Value ignores physical drawer boundaries, the value is unique across the entire system. This data is derived from the MRW.
